Question
========

A neuropsychologist investigates the relationship between crowded environments and short-term memory functioning. All subjects undergo three conditions in a random order: (i) one hour in a quiet room, (ii) one hour in the great outdoors, (iii) one hour in the busy city. At the end of each hour, short-term memory is tested with the "Digit Span" memory test. Which method is best suited to investigate the relationship between crowded environment and short-term memory functioning? 
Answerlist
----------
* ANOVA with only one 'between' factor.
* ANOVA with only one 'within' factor.
* ANOVA with one 'within' and one 'between' factor.
* ANCOVA.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Correct
* Incorrect
